website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight, durable, and reactive, this popular machine doesn't disappoint.
pros: Wide resistance range that reacts to exerciser input
cons: Some complaints about the quality of assembly instructions

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: Great trainer and easy to setup. Took about 10 minutes from out of the box to ready to use. Smooth and road like feel. Also very quiet at 76db around 80rpm. I had this trainer for a little over a week now and only put on a few miles because I still ride outdoors. But I'm looking forward to doing more indoor riding once the weather starts getting colder. What's also nice about the trainer is you can make your bike fit adjustments and video your riding position.
customer_reviews.author: Deck

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Item couldn’t be assembled. 1) The bolt action tube did not fit into the trainer. It didn’t slide in place (stuck in the housing) 2) The feet on the trainer wasn’t level (wobbled on floor surface) 3) The unit had scratches on it. UPDATE: I purchased the Wahoo KICKR SNAP smart bike trainer; it’s more expensive than the CycleOps Fluid 2 but worth the investment if you want a quality on wheel bike trainer that works with several fitness apps including Zwift (immersive riding simulator).
customer_reviews.author: KESM

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: it works great -- with my spare road bike with smooth tires - it too very little time to set up - its pretty quiet -- I added a wahoo speed and cadence sensor and heart monitor and subscribed to Zwift .. now I have an awesome indoor cycling equipment .. much cheaper and better than alternatives
customer_reviews.author: Anthony K

customer_reviews.title: Great option to stationary bikes
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described with one exception. Product promotes being silent which is true of the unit. Once u connect bike there is noise from wind (wheel spinning) and from tire friction against device so advertising is not being truly honest about overall noise. I still recommend as it works as described, is easy to set and remove bike as needed so no need for an extra stationary bike. And last, it is space saving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing 'included' pieces- replacement easy to request
customer_reviews.text: Product- looks good. I have to believe so since it was delivered without all of the purchases material so I currently cannot use it. Bummer. Not sure if anyone else had this problem that two bolts and knob are missing. Disappointed. Update: I called Cycle Ops and explained my situation and they are mailing me the missing parts. No hassle just good customer service. Improvement!!
customer_reviews.author: Suk4n4

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great easy to set up has great resistance. Resistance is adjusted by switching gears. The noise level is just above loud talking. I can easily watch the TV and listen to the sound. I was surprised and concerned that it did not come with any paperwork. But being good stewards of the environment it can download it on your phone. Don't need the climbing block offer pad. Just get a carpet remnant and a piece of 2×4.... but I don't need the climbing block. This is really stable...I can lean down to adjust peddle straps while on bike work no problem
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble by watching YouTube
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this to me & I'm glad I listened to her. It was easy to put together by watching YouTube. I would highly recommend buying trainer bike tire for this bike trainer because it will wear out the track on the tire. Now I can ride anytime indoors & the fan on the trainer will keep part of your back cool because it blow cool air which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of cyclEOps
customer_reviews.text: i have to admit I am a big fan of their products. This is a great trainer for some serious training. During the week it get hard to go out and do the miles. But this trainer allows me to put the hours in the saddle. Sturdy construction. They have fixed some of the issues with the mechanism to hold the bicycle. And it makes it a lot more easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Cp

customer_reviews.title: Requires a removable skewer
customer_reviews.text: I received this just yesterday. It was very easy to assemble (no tools needed) and it seems to be very sturdy and quiet. I will be able to do a lot more cycling than I would have otherwise this winter which is great. I will say that I’m not able to use it with my chainless bike as I’d hoped. This has a rear wheel skewer part you need to use to suspend the bike in the assembly. My chainless driveshaft apparatus doesn’t have a removable axle so I had to use a different bike.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this trainer because it is too cold to cycle outside and all health clubs are closed due to the recent pandemic. It might be too early to declare anything, but so far I am very happy with my purchase! It is much quieter than my vacuum cleaner and I was able to do a hard workout on it by using my gears. If it means anything to you, my FTP is about 170 W and the maximum power I produce on a gym bike is 260 W so I cannot attest to its power capability if you are someone with seriously strong cyclist legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Harder than it looks!
customer_reviews.text: Very challenging to assemble! Had to consult videos and use the rubber side of a hammer for step 2 to get the bolt action tube into the trainer. Directions in the brochure are confusing but I’m not giving up. My friends say it’s great...but I’ve been at it for hours and will need to get someone to help me. Good luck ! Now trying to figure out the skewer :)
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Linke

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product, with a simple construction. Easy to put together. Rides as if on the road. However, it does take up a little bit of space. It also is easy to tell that it uses fluid resistance because a quick acceleration causes the resistance to decrease/slip. Great for a long and consistent ride, but not great for sprints or very high efforts.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service - Arrived broken and company has not reponded to inquiries
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered this so he could exercise while quarantined in south Korea. It was broken when delivered He is Active Duty Army. Any soldier arriving in DRK from the US must quarantine for 14 days. He ordered this bike stand so he could do cardio with his bike while in quarantine It was delivered July 15, 2020; he has been trying to get satisfaction from Saris since then. He is now quarantined and unable to do his cardio as planned. Abysmal Company Do not order from them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G

customer_reviews.title: A great value trainer to get started.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding way to get started in training - in my case, with Zwift. No issues connecting to bike. I am an intermediate spin/cyclist and it solves 80% of my needs. For the price, this is great. It did shred a tire, but if you get the yellow training tires, no more issues. (Harder compound.) My only issue is that it takes about 5-10 minutes for the fluid to warm up and provide good resistance - hence, inaccurate (easy) watts at the beginning if you have to just dive in. Additionally, there isn't a way to crank up resistance for a hill climb or really hard power, like say, a Kaiser magnetic spin bike.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: great indoor trainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get some indoor cycling done. It is pretty quiet all things considered. It works well. I like that it does feel natural when pedaling because of the design. You can't go wrong with this trainer. You should get a stand for your front tire because this does lift your back tire a few inches off the ground. I picked up one and the bike is flat. If you buy two you can stack them to mimic uphill work.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on carpeted floors.
customer_reviews.text: My mountain bike has 29-2.20 tires and it barely fits. It will not work if the stand is on carpeting, but works fine on a hard floor. Haven't used a lot yet, waiting for colder weather, but so far works great. The locking mechanism works stiff, maybe will loosen up with time. UPDATE: Did not work on hard floor either, tire rub and left black mark of melted runner on floor. Put a 2x6 block under the front legs and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: not as compatible as they say and now my bike is damaged
customer_reviews.text: Says it will work with any road bike and mine somehow did not work with it. Now I have to pay almost $100 to fix my bike because taking it apart to place the skewer damaged my bike and the skewer included with the mount was damaged they said because it was not the right bike. If I would have known my bike was not compatible I would not have purchased this and now it is too late to return. Not clear enough on what is compatible or not and now I wasted money on that and need to fix my bike. Furious!!!
customer_reviews.author: A richardson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I have rode just about every exercise bicycle on the market in my 40 plus years of training. This by far has made my mountain bike better than any exercise bike I have ever rode. The app and sensor are awsome. I will put this up over that extremely overpriced exercise bicycle I see on TV by far. Great product, so far, lets see how it holds up, but it does appear to be nothing but quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richter

customer_reviews.title: CycleOps Fluid2 Indoor Trainer
customer_reviews.text: Most awesome buy. It wasn't a new one but everything looked like new. It was missing the Nut that holds the Fluid box in place. I happened to have one that fit fine. This works great with Swift Trainers but you need an ANT+ on your PC/Laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: An open box item sold as new!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived damaged. The box is torn and it is very clear that it was an open box item. I bought this as a new unopened item. If it's an open item, you MUST state so. I didn't even open the box to know if I have all the pieces as I have decided to return it as is.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: This product does precisely what I needed it to.
customer_reviews.text: There’s not much to dislike about this product. Does exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: William Hissam

customer_reviews.title: Bit noisier than expected
customer_reviews.text: This fluid based bike exerciser was billed as quieter than the other version ... hate to hear how loud they are. Experienced some minor issues with setup which were overcome; agree with others comments that the instructions could be better .... and I'm an engineer. Other than that, I am happy with the purchase - as advertised, and it's been getting lots of use.
customer_reviews.author: scooter

customer_reviews.title: Quiet! Great Product! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on trainers prior to spending the money. I have friends with the fan trainers and they are very loud, I wanted something quiet so I could watch TV. This does just that, it’s extremely quiet and feels like you’re riding on the road. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: R. M

customer_reviews.title: Damaged by Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly. Couldn’t assemble it it because the bracket where the L bolt goes into was cast wrong so I am returning it. I’ve had many of the cyclops trainers and this hasn’t happened to me before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: I love the price compared to other trainers. It was relatively easy to assemble and it’s easy to move when I need to move it aside so my kids have more room to play. I find that I get a great workout on it and I actually look forward to riding inside. I bought the stand for the front wheel and it it nice and level. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cannot lock bike down b/c shaft won't move fully into slot.  No support reply
customer_reviews.text: I assemble the trainer per the manual, including changing out the skewer to the one provided. I cannot move the shaft into a lock position so the bike is not stable, but, instead, wobbles in the stand and comes loose after just 5-10 minutes of riding. I have reached out to Support twice to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that I wish it would offer more resistance. It's fine for cardio (which is what I really bought it for), but it's not like cranking hills, and I wish it had such an adjustable setting. Overall, I am still very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: CNH

customer_reviews.title: Loud but easy
customer_reviews.text: So slightly misleading advertising; the trainer itself isn't "smart" so it doesn't actually interface with Zwift or whatever the other app is. The only connectivity you may have is a Bluetooth or ANT+ dongle attached to your computer (for your sensors). Noise is also an issue, a lot louder than I expected. Overall though very easy to use. More or less plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Instructions Lacking
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and a good design but I found the assembly instructions half-assed. Of course I got it together but I'm handy and mechanically inclined. It's an excellent trainer but the company should provide an video link for those who need it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd F.

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this Cycle trainer little to no noise at all, my bike is a Diamondback Mason 2 27.5 2.8 fatty tire of course I had to do some modifications to my bike mainly switch my rear tire to a 27.5 1.95 THICKSLICK since the Saris Cycle ops is limited to a 2.0 tire & my thru axel length is 12x180mm so I had to purchase a kinetic tru axel adapter item #T2101 to make everything compatible. It took a while to research everything I love it I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Flores

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how it works no one available to talk about the problems, the weekend etc
customer_reviews.text: Missing a small part Not expensive but very frustrated Means I have to go buy it Or other negative options Limited assembly direction Didn't realize that I would have to switch my stock bike equipment
customer_reviews.author: edward carter

customer_reviews.title: Has been working great for me
customer_reviews.text: Has been working great for me. I use this for the local indoor rides, and I use rollers at home. Has enough resistance for me, but a strong rider may find it has some limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Tiny axle doesn't work for all bikes
customer_reviews.text: By the time I found someone (bike shop) who could finally put this together, only to find out the stupid "axle" that came with the bike did not FIT my bike. And now return window closed. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase and Trainer
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy. Came from the warehouse as used, but was in as new condition. Thanks Amazon! The trainer works wonderfully and is very quite. Also generates some wind to keep you cool. And as I live in MN, I've had several chances to use it. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing trainer.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet and solid. You can’t beat this trainer. Never used one before but very realistic to the road, but more convenient. Cycling computer works great to track distance and speed like a normal ride too. Very happy with the purchase and it’s been flawless so far.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised,
customer_reviews.text: The product is great! However, I had never bought one before and the verbiage of the seller's description leads one to believe that it is blue tooth. You need both wahoo to connect sensors to allow this product to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kelp

customer_reviews.title: Fundamental quality flaw - unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe a product at this price could have such a basic machining quality issue of a bolt not being able to thread into the housing, but here we are. Complete junk, and so annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The Fluid2 does not provide as much resistance as I expected nor as much as a less expensive magnetic trainer I have. I had to contact Cycleops customer service to ask for clarification about assembly because of inadequate instructions. I sent Cycleops an email describing my disappointment and recommendations for making the assembly instructions more instructive and they have not responded to me. Overall disappointed with the Fluid2 trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Great Trainer, did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I love this trainer. It is easy to set up and use and I don't have a problem.with the sound level. It is sturdy. I have hooked up to Zwift and Rouvy as well but you have to buy cadence sensor, speed sensor, and a dongle to make it compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great First Trainer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first trainer and I have loved using it. It was super easy to assemble and is very portable. I can move it anywhere around my house to bike with it. Very simple to just put the bike on it and go! It is very quiet, but definitely not silent. I have enjoyed it greatly and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy
customer_reviews.text: Product works great, Just had to buy a new wheel. Had to get a new wheel that had a quick release axle so the trainer skewer could be installed. My bike had the normal axle, one solid piece that gets secured to the bike frame with 2 nuts, so I wasn't able to install the skewer so I could put the bike on the trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not zwift compatible. Total lie
customer_reviews.text: This is false advertising. This is not zwift compatible. It's not Bluetooth enabled. I bought this thing for a family member and now I have to buy an ant transmitter and a speed sensor. This is not ok.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdlyfe

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor trainer but tricky resistance adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I got this indoor trainer based on the reviews. It has been working well. I have it 4 stars instead of 5 because I wished it would have a better way to adjust resistance and to identify how much of it is applied when the knob is turned.
customer_reviews.author: Nuncio @ FL

customer_reviews.title: Decent but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Seems solid; holds the bike well but it's noisy. Would recommend but not to condo/apartment dwellers because of the noise level.
customer_reviews.author: RedSoxFan

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks like crazy after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: This was easy enough to put together and worked well for one ride. The second time resulted in a loud, continuous squeak you can hear through the house. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Dad

customer_reviews.title: Very little resistance
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Easy in and out. I just wish it had more resistance. I'm using a Mountain Bike. Even in the most aggressive gears, it doesn't feel like the resistance changes much. For competitive cyclists, the resistance is probably perfect, but I expected the resistance to be more than a slight incline.
customer_reviews.author: TeraLyn Rocknak

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy this product
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this product. Great for winter training. Easy to attach bike and assemble. Be sure to purchase rubber mat and front tire block
customer_reviews.author: Harold Chilton

customer_reviews.title: fantastic trainer.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for close to a year now and I love it. I recently set up speed and cadence sensors and connected to Zwift and now I'm using it every day. Take that winter!
customer_reviews.author: Shawnd

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic workout
customer_reviews.text: I studied many different bike trainers before selecting the cycle ops. Glad I did my research. Great trainer and will give you a great workout. Easy to mount and dismount bike and easy storage when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: excellent piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: very good strong and just what I needed for indoor exercise work out
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD ZIZZO

customer_reviews.title: not a new condition
customer_reviews.text: it should be described as an open box item. i bought a new one but reveived and open box one. the components inside looked fine though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: This is now a permanent piece of furniture in our living room. Easy to set up and attach your cycle. Exercise and watch TV! The future is NOW!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Heron

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor training
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and feels just like riding on the road. The resistance is speed dependent but that’s just the nature of fluid trainers.
customer_reviews.author: A Fluffy Husky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My mom and dad LOVE this. If they can use it anyone can. Its well built, reasonable, and works great!
customer_reviews.author: donbridger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Love This Thing!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, works great, not to loud. Solid piece of equipment. Great workout!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This surpassed expectations. On a carpet with the mat... all I hear is my chain, and even that is practically silent. Well built, compact and smooth. I'd recommend this , no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: g.b.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Dislike box had been opened and retaped. It appears to have been tampered with or not new but sold as new. The correct assembly pieces were not included. Instructions also not complete.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Smooth operator.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to mount bike. Resistance is weak compared to my old TravelTrac. Have to pedal above 70 rpm to feel any increased resistance. Flywheel fan is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G Artis

customer_reviews.title: I returned it because I could not put it together and it didn't seem like it was going to work well
customer_reviews.text: I returned it because I could not put it together and it didn't seem like it was going to work well
customer_reviews.author: vikle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and quiet in use
customer_reviews.text: It is everything it was advertised to be. Easy to assemble and quiet in use. I put my cyclometer on the back wheel and the computer on the crossbar beneath the seat and can clock my time, speed, etc. So far, simply shifting gears gives me enough resistance. Happy to be able to watch video or TV to pass the time. Definitely keeping me fit and sane this winter season! Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: bref

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer. Smooth and well built.
customer_reviews.text: Great trainer. Quiet enough to watch a movie while pedaling (you need to turn it up but it can be done). Smooth and solid. This is the best trainer that I am aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Buehner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Recommend. Did as advertised. East to install. Use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: paul azar

customer_reviews.title: This is a great trainer. Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trainer. Easy to setup, and a great way to get quality indoor rides during the winter. Very portable too, and folds down for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: There is plenty of resistance in higher gears, still works perfectly over a year later. The only possible downfall would be that there is some noise associated with the bicycle's wheel's contact with the drive wheel. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: michael dittenber

customer_reviews.title: So many missing parts - Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed..it doesn't have the cone to put in the skewer; nor does it have the tube and the lollipop lever to tighten..
customer_reviews.author: kanwal

customer_reviews.title: Do not order.  Try a better brand...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Unable to assemble. Maybe wrong parts or wrong instructions. Was very excited about this but very frustrated. My instructional manual was completely not mine. Even trying to figure it out, something was very wrong. Returning and looking for a new brand.... couldn’t take my call,,,
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It is great!
customer_reviews.text: Husband uses this when he can't ride outdoors. It is great!
customer_reviews.author: S. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for indoor cycling, but much noisier than most of the reviews would lead you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Overall works well
customer_reviews.text: Overall works well. You defiently need a trainer specific read wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Rosko

customer_reviews.title: Bike Trainer
customer_reviews.text: The box was completely old looking and beat up. The trainer was scuffed up and dirty looking like it had been used and returned or a floor model, which was not indicated in the advertised price of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Harrel

customer_reviews.title: Number one rated for a good reason!
customer_reviews.text: Number one rated for a good reason! Super easy to set up, though you do need to replace your skewer with the one they provide. Instructions are simple to follow. Gives a great workout and then stows away out of sight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My best purchase from amazon to date. I use it daily and lost 20 lbs in 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Paul Foley

customer_reviews.title: Indoor fitness bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice works for indoor cycling. Not too much resistance and a bit noisy for an apartment. But when you can't bike in the snow, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Designer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product, but make sure you have your bike very secure. I fell off my bike when I stood up after riding for a week. The locking mechanism came loose so just check it before getting on. I am sure it was my fault and probably did not have it on tight enough......
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Maines-Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Easy sey up
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to set up. Its pretty quiet and feels great when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Great product fair price
customer_reviews.text: Great product and a great design, it feels very sturdy and strong when your using it and provides plenty of resistance I'm 5'11" and weigh about 194 pounds and in decent shape and after my first 20 minute interval workout my legs are toast.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Riding again
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as much resistance as I would like but works well. Would buy again. Worth the money. Easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: William May

customer_reviews.title: Love this trainer
customer_reviews.text: Works like a dream and is very quiet. Replacement training skewers are also cheap and easy to find. I bought an extra for my husband's bike. The flywheel generates a bit of a breeze which helps keep me cool during a workout.
customer_reviews.author: A Harrill

customer_reviews.title: Love Riding Indoors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so that I can continue riding, and a friend recommended this product and send me the link to purchasing it. It has been working out great, and I am improving my fitness level.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Francis

customer_reviews.title: The thing I like the most is the smooth increase in load as ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an Electra Townie mounted on this trainer and I'm using it to to rehab a total knee replacement. The thing I like the most is the smooth increase in load as your speed increases. Easy, straightforward setup. Saris produces quality products.
customer_reviews.author: ejp

customer_reviews.title: Great smooth motion as you peddle
customer_reviews.text: Great smooth motion as you peddle. Easy to set up and is much quieter than expected. Very sturdy piece of equipment as I was at 300lbs. when I started using this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M Bouton

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: Great trainer. My minoura trainer was not giving much of a workout. This one turned it back into an actual workout.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great quality easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is great winter is coming it will keep me in shape. Great quality
customer_reviews.author: hobie1

customer_reviews.title: This trainer gives real resistance. I'm an ultra runner ...
customer_reviews.text: This trainer gives real resistance. I'm an ultra runner giving my injured foot a rest... after 1 week of daily use of the fluid trainer, I'm taking a rest day to let my sore hamstrings grow. If you're new to trainers, watch a video or sprint through commercial breaks!
customer_reviews.author: AtlGuy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little loud and wore down the tire within 2 rides, but I'm still rocking it daily.
customer_reviews.author: KMS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, fun to ride on, and quiet enough not to bother any of my apartment neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It's doing great and there is not a lot of noice.
customer_reviews.author: Marcene Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up with smooth resistance
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was expecting it to be. Easy to set up with smooth resistance, all in a very stable platform. I really enjoy the ability to stay in condition indoors when the outdoor conditions are prohibitive.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Brillhart

customer_reviews.title: Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this trainer for a couple of years now and it has held up well. Good product
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and hook up with bike
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and hook up with bike. Smooth operating and quiet. Love this trainer! (glad I ordered the mat, too, so I can use it confidently on my indoor floors)
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Urbon

customer_reviews.title: Just Ride!!
customer_reviews.text: RIDE, RIDE, RIDE, This products is working great. I just keep on riding.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi A. Thom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quality product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a little over a year now and give it 5 stars. Easy to set-up for on the fly usage and you are able to adjust the resistance on your bike by switching gears.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Received with missing parts. Hi ha and knob to mount the fluid tension part to the assembly was missing. Bad quality control
customer_reviews.author: Atsray

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!!! It is worth every penny spent. It is quiet enough that my infant will nap in the same room that I use it in. It was easy to install and works phenomenally.
customer_reviews.author: The Wardlaws

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Makes for a great workout when the weather is bad!
customer_reviews.author: New Mexico customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and take down, very quite. The bike is the noisy part now.
customer_reviews.author: Slygoat

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I just received it and it was relatively easy to assemble. So far I have used it twice and I am very happy with it,
customer_reviews.author: Susan W.

customer_reviews.title: ... a little noisier than when we tested one just like it at the bike shop
customer_reviews.text: No issues yet except a little noisier than when we tested one just like it at the bike shop. But is works.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to cheaper procts
customer_reviews.text: The resistance is not consistent throughout the ride. I think all fluid traners have a change in resistance after the warm-up period but this one contiues to fluctuate even after an hour. It's not a bad product bit my old performance brand was better for a lot less $.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice trainer
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. Easy to set up, works well. Glad I pulled the trigger on this purchase. I also purchased a riser for the front wheel when I bought this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Miller

product_meta.title: Saris CycleOps Fluid2 Indoor Bike Trainer
feature_bullets: WORKS WITH ZWIFT: Hop on and ride with others on Zwift, Rouvy, and other online training apps
BEST SELLING TRAINER: The CycleOps Fluid2 is the best selling trainer in the USA. Made in the USA with 100% recyclable, non-rusting materials
FLUID RESISTANCE IS QUIET AND CONSISTENT: CycleOps Fluid2 powertuned technology makes for a quiet, consistent, ride every time you get on your bike indoors. Noise level at 20 mph is 64-68 decibels
RUGGED 2-INCH ROUND 16-GAUGE STEEL FRAME: Tested to the combined weight (rider and bike) of 300 pounds
STABLE WIDE FRAME: Adjustable footpads for a stable ride on most surfaces; Compatible with virtual training apps.
Comes with a lifetime warranty from cycleOps
Adjustable footpads for a stable ride on most surfaces
